actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Trove Labs Travel Stipend [REDACTED] - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "Hello! I am Brandon Cantu, and along with my co-founder David Leer, we are Trove Labs! We have been in the NEAR ecosystem for over 3 years. We have built multiple projects on NEAR protocol and are core contributors for Neko, and Jump DeFi! We will be traveling from Washington State to Bangkok to participate in [REDACTED]! We will be submitting our own project.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "**NEAR Contributions**\\\\nWe have activley contributed to the NEAR ecosystem by launching [Neko](https://www.nekotoken.xyz/), [Jump DeFi](jumpdefi.xyz), hosting Near at Night, and creating video content. We will be traveling from Seattle Washington and will be creating a hackathoin submission using Bitte AI agents!\\\\n\\\\n**Prior Hackathons**\\\\nNearcon 2022 - *Participated but did not submit project\\\\n\\\\nWe are active builders in the NEAR community and have multiple projects we maintain in the ecosystem. We are asking to be considered for a stipend to help subsidize our particpation in this years [Redacted] conference.\\\\n\\\\n**Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs**\\\\nDeparting from SEA\\\\nLanding at BKK\\\\n\\\\nFlights: ~$1200 USD per person x 2\\\\nTotal Estimated Cost: $2400 USD (requesting a $2000 stipend)\\\\n\\\\n**Project Plan**\\\\nWe have a submission in progress and once we are ready, we will submit through Devpost. We are also traveling to participate in Olympic Village and create content with the Build DAO House, in an effort to cover hackathon teams and what they ahve built! Once submitted, I will update this proposal with the URL to my project submissions.\\\\n\\\\nThank you for your consideration!", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "trovelabs.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses", "Bounty"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130512208}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @trovelabs.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Trove Labs Travel Stipend [REDACTED] - Bangkok, Nov. 2024\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHello! I am Brandon Cantu, and along with my co-founder David Leer, we are Trove Labs! We have been in the NEAR ecosystem for over 3 years. We have built multiple projects on NEAR protocol and are core contributors for Neko, and Jump DeFi! We will be traveling from Washington State to Bangkok to participate in [REDACTED]! We will be submitting our own project.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=92)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

We will be submitting our own project.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "editor_id": "trovelabs.near", "timestamp": "1729121126303246418", "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "**NEAR Contributions**\\\\nWe have activley contributed to the NEAR ecosystem by launching [Neko](https://www.nekotoken.xyz/), [Jump DeFi](jumpdefi.xyz), hosting Near at Night, and creating video content. We will be traveling from Seattle Washington and will be creating a hackathoin submission using Bitte AI agents!\\\\n\\\\n**Prior Hackathons**\\\\nNearcon 2022 - *Participated but did not submit project\\\\n\\\\nWe are active builders in the NEAR community and have multiple projects we maintain in the ecosystem. We are asking to be considered for a stipend to help subsidize our particpation in this years [Redacted] conference.\\\\n\\\\n**Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs**\\\\nDeparting from SEA\\\\nLanding at BKK\\\\n\\\\nFlights: ~$1200 USD per person x 2\\\\nTotal Estimated Cost: $2400 USD (requesting a $2000 stipend)\\\\n\\\\n**Project Plan**\\\\nWe have a submission in progress and once we are ready, we will submit through Devpost. We are also traveling to participate in Olympic Village and create content with the Build DAO House, in an effort to cover hackathon teams and what they ahve built! Once submitted, I will update this proposal with the URL to my project submissions.\\\\n\\\\nThank you for your consideration!", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "trovelabs.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "trovelabs.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault powered by Unblock Technolabs Travel Stipend", "summary": "I am applying for a travel and accommodation stipend to attend the Redacted Hackathon in Bangkok, where I will represent Unblock Technolabs and showcase my project, the NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault. This project aims to tokenize real-world assets using the NEAR Protocol, demonstrating both technical expertise and innovative use cases.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**Applicant Information:**\\\\nNames: Dhavalkumar Davra\\\\nCompany: Unblock Technolabs\\\\nEvent: Redacted Hackathon, Bangkok\\\\nProject: NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault\\\\n\\\\n**About Me:**\\\\nI am a co-founder of Unblock Technolabs, a web3 development company recognized as one of the t[op 10 web3 startups in India in 2023 ](https://startup.siliconindia.com/vendor/unblock-technolabs-bringing-the-power-of-blockchain-to-your-fingertips-cid-19731.html) by Silicon India Magazine. Our company has successfully served over 50 clients, primarily in the Ethereum ecosystem. With growing client demand for NEAR Protocol solutions, I am committed to expanding our services into the NEAR ecosystem. Attending this hackathon will allow me to further our knowledge, build strong connections within the NEAR community, and showcase our skills.\\\\n\\\\n**Near RWA Tokenized Vault:**\\\\nThe NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault is a decentralized vault built on the NEAR Protocol that allows users to tokenize real-world assets (RWAs) such as real estate, commodities, or other physical assets. The vault enables users to pool funds and invest in these tokenized assets, with the underlying asset values determining the pool\\\\u{2019}s overall value. Investors in the vault will earn returns based on the appreciation of the tokenized assets, providing a seamless way for decentralized finance (DeFi) participants to invest in real-world assets through blockchain technology. This project not only demonstrates the scalability of the NEAR Protocol but also bridges the gap between traditional finance and decentralized finance by leveraging tokenization.\\\\n\\\\n**Event Goals:**\\\\n> Present the NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault: A project designed to tokenize real-world assets using the NEAR Protocol, highlighting our commitment to innovative blockchain solutions.\\\\n> Contribute to NEAR Ecosystem: I plan to actively participate in the hackathon and contribute through this project while learning from the community.\\\\n> Expand Service Offerings: By building on NEAR, I intend to explore and address increasing client demand for solutions beyond Ethereum.\\\\n\\\\n**Estimated Expenses:**\\\\nFlight Tickets (Mumbai, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand): $450\\\\nAccommodation: $300\\\\nTotal Expenses Requested: **$750**\\\\nI am only requesting support for flights and accommodation. All other expenses, including local transport, food, and miscellaneous costs, will be covered by me.\\\\n\\\\n**Why I Am an Ideal Candidate for the Travel Grant:**\\\\nAs the co-founder of Unblock Technolabs, I bring a wealth of experience in blockchain development. Having served more than 50 clients and being recognized as a leading web3 startup in India, I am eager to contribute to and grow within the NEAR ecosystem. I have received numerous client queries about NEAR-based solutions, and this hackathon presents an excellent opportunity to expand our expertise and demonstrate our commitment to the ecosystem. The NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault project I am bringing to the event aligns perfectly with NEAR\\\\\\'s goals, and my active participation will contribute meaningfully to the community.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "020866462aea47dd2a8ffb7b36bf782917bf091de9e03bae867fe4e4f95de3fa", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "750", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130626182}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @020866462aea47dd2a8ffb7b36bf782917bf091de9e03bae867fe4e4f95de3fa\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault powered by Unblock Technolabs Travel Stipend\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nI am applying for a travel and accommodation stipend to attend the Redacted Hackathon in Bangkok, where I will represent Unblock Technolabs and showcase my project, the NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault. This project aims to tokenize real-world assets using the NEAR Protocol, demonstrating both technical expertise and innovative use cases.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=93)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

This project not only demonstrates the scalability of the NEAR Protocol but also bridges the gap between traditional finance and decentralized finance by leveraging tokenization.\\\\n\\\\n**Event Goals:**\\\\n> Present the NEAR RWA Tokenized Vault: A project designed to tokenize real-world assets using the NEAR Protocol, highlighting our commitment to innovative blockchain solutions.\\\\n> Contribute to NEAR Ecosystem: I plan to actively participate in the hackathon and contribute through this project while learning from the community.\\\\n> Expand Service Offerings: By building on NEAR, I intend to explore and address increasing client demand for solutions beyond Ethereum.\\\\n\\\\n**Estimated Expenses:**\\\\nFlight Tickets (Mumbai, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand): $450\\\\nAccommodation: $300\\\\nTotal Expenses Requested: **$750**\\\\nI am only requesting support for flights and accommodation. All other expenses, including local transport, food, and miscellaneous costs, will be covered by me.\\\\n\\\\n**Why I Am an Ideal Candidate for the Travel Grant:**\\\\nAs the co-founder of Unblock Technolabs, I bring a wealth of experience in blockchain development. {"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend Request for Redacted IRL", "summary": "reCEPTION is an API service platform that uses AI to analyze smart contracts in real time and enhance security. Inspired by reCAPTCHA, it verifies the safety of contracts before transactions are processed, supporting secure cryptocurrency payments on e-commerce and Web3 platforms.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "# Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 5 from Global.\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'m Saurabh Kaplas, a smart contract developer with over 1 year of experience!\\\\nAnd the team composition is a Software engineer 2, AI engineer 1 and Smart Contract Developer 1.\\\\n\\\\n[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/saurabhkaplas)\\\\n[Github](https://github.com/skpkss)\\\\n[Portfolio](https://saurabhkaplas.netlify.app/)\\\\n[Telegram](https://t.me/insane03)\\\\n\\\\n**This proposal is for me(Saurabh Kaplas).**\\\\n\\\\n# Description\\\\nreCeption is a Web3 security project designed to enhance the safety of smart contracts in decentralized ecosystems. Inspired by reCAPTCHA, it provides a security checkpoint for smart contracts by analyzing them for vulnerabilities before transactions are processed. By integrating NEAR AI, reCeption offers real-time contract analysis, helping both Web2 and Web3 platforms, such as e-commerce and decentralized applications, to securely handle cryptocurrency payments and other blockchain interactions.\\\\n\\\\nOur target users include developers, businesses, and everyday users who need a reliable tool to ensure their smart contracts are secure, making blockchain technology more trustworthy and user-friendly.\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop reCEPTION during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve reCEPTION and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential and secure to create Web2 & Web3 value in AI based securify solution. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n# Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $800 (Chandigarh, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand ; round trip)\\\\nAccommodation per person: $200\\\\nMy Request: $1000\\\\n\\\\nI am only requesting assistance for flights and accommodation. We will manage other expenses such as food and local transport ourselves.\\\\n\\\\n# Project Overview:\\\\nreCEPTION is an AI-powered security platform that offers functionality similar to reCAPTCHA, providing automated verification solutions for both Web2 and Web3 environments. The project aims to enhance the security and quality of smart contracts and provide automated validation solutions for users and developers.\\\\n\\\\n# Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining the hackathons link i have participated in the past :\\\\n\\\\nETH Online 2024 : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/eth-various-swusm \\\\nLFGHO 2024 :  https://ethglobal.com/showcase/ghotoevents-gy8os\\\\nETH Online 2023 :  https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tradecode-ddxrp\\\\nSustainable Development Hackathon:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Pm0QT2IdAvZu22I_wz6w5TTluzEUrck3/view?usp=sharing\\\\nIBM Technovate : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DJIp5vnCVf8gFGTX4qAucC1QSkE-8NT1/view?usp=sharing\\\\n\\\\n# Why I Need Support\\\\nAlthough I currently have no income, I am very interested in the Web3 ecosystem, and I really want to participate and contribute to global events. Therefore, if Near Protocol gives us this great opportunity, we will do our best and appreciate the opportunity to directly activate Near Protocol\\\\\\'s good projects in the ecosystem!\\\\n\\\\n# Conclusion\\\\nI would like to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok because I would like to continue developing and presenting reCEPTION in the field NEAR to show off really good security solutions to the web3. Your support means a lot to us and will make our project a reality.\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [87], "receiver_account": "saurabhkaplas.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Meetup", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130637209}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @saurabhkaplas.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Travel Stipend Request for Redacted IRL\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nreCEPTION is an API service platform that uses AI to analyze smart contracts in real time and enhance security. Inspired by reCAPTCHA, it verifies the safety of contracts before transactions are processed, supporting secure cryptocurrency payments on e-commerce and Web3 platforms.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=94)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 94, "snapshot": {"name": "Travel Stipend Request for Redacted IRL", "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses", "Meetup"], "summary": "reCEPTION is an API service platform that uses AI to analyze smart contracts in real time and enhance security. Inspired by reCAPTCHA, it verifies the safety of contracts before transactions are processed, supporting secure cryptocurrency payments on e-commerce and Web3 platforms.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "editor_id": "saurabhkaplas.near", "timestamp": "1729261044310976005", "supervisor": null, "description": "# Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 5 from Global.\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'m Saurabh Kaplas, a smart contract developer with over 1 year of experience!\\\\nAnd the team composition is a Software engineer 2, AI engineer 1 and Smart Contract Developer 1.\\\\n\\\\n[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/saurabhkaplas)\\\\n[Github](https://github.com/skpkss)\\\\n[Portfolio](https://saurabhkaplas.netlify.app/)\\\\n[Telegram](https://t.me/insane03)\\\\n\\\\n**This proposal is for me(Saurabh Kaplas).**\\\\n\\\\n# Description\\\\nreCeption is a Web3 security project designed to enhance the safety of smart contracts in decentralized ecosystems. Inspired by reCAPTCHA, it provides a security checkpoint for smart contracts by analyzing them for vulnerabilities before transactions are processed. By integrating NEAR AI, reCeption offers real-time contract analysis, helping both Web2 and Web3 platforms, such as e-commerce and decentralized applications, to securely handle cryptocurrency payments and other blockchain interactions.\\\\n\\\\nOur target users include developers, businesses, and everyday users who need a reliable tool to ensure their smart contracts are secure, making blockchain technology more trustworthy and user-friendly.\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop reCEPTION during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve reCEPTION and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential and secure to create Web2 & Web3 value in AI based securify solution. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n# Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $800 (Chandigarh, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand ; round trip)\\\\nAccommodation per person: $200\\\\nMy Request: $1000\\\\n\\\\nI am only requesting assistance for flights and accommodation. We will manage other expenses such as food and local transport ourselves.\\\\n\\\\n# Project Overview:\\\\nreCEPTION is an AI-powered security platform that offers functionality similar to reCAPTCHA, providing automated verification solutions for both Web2 and Web3 environments. The project aims to enhance the security and quality of smart contracts and provide automated validation solutions for users and developers.\\\\n\\\\n# Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining the hackathons link i have participated in the past :\\\\n\\\\nETH Online 2024 : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/eth-various-swusm \\\\nLFGHO 2024 :  https://ethglobal.com/showcase/ghotoevents-gy8os\\\\nETH Online 2023 :  https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tradecode-ddxrp\\\\nSustainable Development Hackathon:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Pm0QT2IdAvZu22I_wz6w5TTluzEUrck3/view?usp=sharing\\\\nIBM Technovate : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DJIp5vnCVf8gFGTX4qAucC1QSkE-8NT1/view?usp=sharing\\\\n\\\\n# Why I Need Support\\\\nAlthough I currently have no income, I am very interested in the Web3 ecosystem, and I really want to participate and contribute to global events. Therefore, if Near Protocol gives us this great opportunity, we will do our best and appreciate the opportunity to directly activate Near Protocol\\\\\\'s good projects in the ecosystem!\\\\n\\\\n# Conclusion\\\\nI would like to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok because I would like to continue developing and presenting reCEPTION in the field NEAR to show off really good security solutions to the web3. Your support means a lot to us and will make our project a reality.\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [87], "receiver_account": "saurabhkaplas.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "saurabhkaplas.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"index": {"notify": "[{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"events-committee.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"proposal/mention\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"proposal\\\\\\\":94,\\\\\\\"widgetAccountId\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"events-committee.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"notifier\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"saurabhkaplas.near\\\\\\\"}}]"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend Request for [REDACTED] IRL (Bangkok, 2024)", "summary": "My name is Arin Dewangan, a blockchain developer, hackathon enthusiast, and student at Chanakya University, Bengaluru. We are seeking a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok, where we will contribute our expertise in decentralized technologies, mentor participating teams, and present a project that bridges AI and Web3. This event represents a remarkable opportunity to demonstrate our work, exchange ideas, and collaborate with the global blockchain community.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## NEAR Contributions\\\\nWe have been active contributors to the NEAR ecosystem, engaging in open-source projects and decentralized applications that align with NEAR\\\\\\'s vision. Our contributions include participation in the NEAR MetaBUILD III Hackathon and support for various community-driven initiatives.\\\\n\\\\nNEAR MetaBUILD III Hackathon: https://devpost.com/software/nft-e-ar-th-nftd-stablecoin-backed-by-virtual-land\\\\n\\\\n## Hackathon Experience\\\\nOur team has participated in and won several high-profile hackathons, including:\\\\n\\\\n- **IIT HACKS** (Winner, 1st place)  \\\\n- **Hackfusion 1.0**  \\\\n- **FuturistFest 2024 X NASA**  \\\\n- NEAR MetaBUILD III Hackathon: https://devpost.com/software/nft-e-ar-th-nftd-stablecoin-backed-by-virtual-land  \\\\n- Chainlink Fall 2022 Hackathon: https://devpost.com/software/nft-e-ar-th-nftd-stablecoin-backed-by-virtual-land-6fgljs  \\\\n- TRON Grand Hackathon - Season 3: https://devpost.com/software/nft-e-ar-th-nftd-stablecoin-backed-by-virtual-land-2o4kfe  \\\\n- And many others, working on solutions combining blockchain and AI technologies\\\\n\\\\nThese experiences have strengthened our ability to collaborate effectively, deliver innovative solutions, and solve real-world problems through cutting-edge technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Top Projects\\\\nWe have worked on a number of impactful projects, including:\\\\n\\\\n- **NFT E(AR)TH** & **NFTD** (Stablecoin backed by virtual land)  \\\\n- Trax AI (Submitted to IIT Hacks): https://devpost.com/software/trax-ai  \\\\n- Farmfuture AI (Submitted to FuturistFest 2024 X NASA): https://devpost.com/software/farmfuture-crop-suitability-prediction  \\\\n- And many others across blockchain, AI, and sustainability\\\\n\\\\n## Links\\\\n- Devpost: https://devpost.com/arindewangan  \\\\n- GitHub: https://github.com/arindewangan  \\\\n- LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/in/arindewangan\\\\n\\\\n## Team Information\\\\nThis project is a collaboration between **Arin Dewangan** and **Gulshan**, both experienced in blockchain and AI technologies. Together, we have successfully developed and presented innovative solutions at various hackathons and competitions.\\\\n\\\\n## Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs\\\\nHere is our travel plan for [REDACTED] in Bangkok:\\\\n\\\\n- **Flights (Bengaluru \\\\u{2192} Bangkok):** $300  \\\\n- **Other Travel Expenses (Accommodation, Local Transport, etc.):** $200  \\\\n- **Total Estimated Cost:** $500 (requesting a stipend of $500 to cover full travel and participation costs)\\\\n\\\\n## Project Work\\\\nWe are currently developing an innovative project titled **\\\\\\\"Decentralized AI-Powered Reputation System for Web3.\\\\\\\"** The system will use AI to analyze users\\\\\\' on-chain behavior across multiple blockchains, generating a tamper-proof reputation score that is recorded on-chain. This score would be applicable for DeFi participants, NFT traders, DAO members, and dApp users, increasing trust and accountability in decentralized ecosystems.\\\\n\\\\nKey features include:\\\\n- **AI Evaluation:** Trustworthiness based on transaction history, community contributions, and engagement in Web3 ecosystems.\\\\n- **Decentralized:** Reputation scores will be stored on-chain, ensuring transparency and user control.\\\\n- **Chain-Agnostic:** This system will aggregate user activity across multiple blockchains to create a unified reputation score for all Web3 interactions.\\\\n\\\\nThis project addresses a key challenge in decentralized networks\\\\u{2014}building trust and accountability\\\\u{2014}while providing a scalable solution applicable across DeFi, NFTs, and DAOs.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nWe are excited about the opportunity to participate in [REDACTED] and contribute our innovative project to the hackathon. The stipend will help cover travel expenses, allowing us to focus fully on developing and refining this solution. Thank you for considering our application.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "arind.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130719515}

We are seeking a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok, where we will contribute our expertise in decentralized technologies, mentor participating teams, and present a project that bridges AI and Web3. {"body": {"name": "Stipend Support for [REDACTED] Hackathon Journey (Bangkok, 2024)", "summary": "My name is Gulshan Dewangan, a blockchain developer and Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH). I am passionate about leveraging decentralized technologies to solve real-world challenges. Along with Arin, I am applying for a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok. We plan to contribute to the hackathon by sharing our expertise, mentoring teams, and presenting a unique project that merges AI with Web3. This event offers an opportunity to exchange ideas with the global community and showcase work.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Hackathon Experience\\\\n\\\\nI have participated in and excelled at various hackathons, such as:\\\\n\\\\n- **Spring Hacks by Code4TheFuture**\\\\n- **OneHacks IV**\\\\n- **FuturistFest 2024 X NASA**\\\\n- **Bay Area Hacks**\\\\n- **MedHacks Season 2**\\\\n\\\\nThese experiences have equipped me with the ability to collaborate, innovate, and create impactful solutions through cutting-edge technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Hackathon Projects\\\\n\\\\nI have developed multiple projects that emphasize AI and blockchain, including:\\\\n\\\\n- **AI FOOD**: An AI-powered platform that optimizes food distribution.\\\\n- **FarmFuture - Crop Suitability Prediction**: A tool designed to help farmers select the best crops for their land using AI (Submitted to FuturistFest 2024 X NASA).\\\\n- **MythBuster AI**: An AI system aimed at debunking common myths and misinformation.\\\\n\\\\n## Blockchain and Ethical Hacking Expertise\\\\n\\\\nAs a CEH-certified professional, I bring a strong understanding of cybersecurity principles to blockchain development. My skills ensure that decentralized applications are not only innovative but also secure and robust.\\\\n\\\\n## Team Collaboration\\\\n\\\\nArin Dewangan and I have a proven track record of working together on innovative projects in the blockchain and AI domains. Our combined skills make us a strong team for the [REDACTED] hackathon, and we are excited to showcase our latest project.\\\\n\\\\n## Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs\\\\n\\\\nHere is our joint travel plan for [REDACTED] in Bangkok:\\\\n\\\\n- **Flights (Bengaluru \\\\u{2192} Bangkok)**: $300\\\\n- **Other Travel Expenses (Accommodation, Local Transport, etc.)**: $200\\\\n- **Total Estimated Cost**: $500 (requesting a stipend of $500 to cover full travel and participation costs)\\\\n\\\\n## Project Work\\\\n\\\\nWe are jointly developing an innovative project titled **\\\\\\\"Decentralized AI-Powered Reputation System for Web3\\\\\\\"**, aiming to enhance trust and accountability in decentralized networks through a tamper-proof, AI-driven reputation score.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\n\\\\nAttending [REDACTED] will enable us to focus on refining our project while connecting with like-minded innovators. The stipend would help cover our travel expenses, allowing us to fully engage with this incredible opportunity. Thank you for considering our application.\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "gulshand.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130726462}

I am passionate about leveraging decentralized technologies to solve real-world challenges. Along with Arin, I am applying for a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok. {"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "As a contributor to the NEAR ecosystem from the very beginning, with my own experiments and to the DevHUB platform, I very much look forward to meet all the great people that I\\\\\\'m hacking together with on these projects every day. Also I have submitted the JsInRust+NearOpenAI proejct for the hackaton, and a speaker proposal for it as well ( including WebAssembly Music too ). For me being at Redacted Bangkok will have great value, and I hope also for others to meet me as well. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "devs.near", "description": "# Purpose\\\\nI am applying for the overseas travel stipend of $1,575 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\n\\\\n# My Records\\\\nI got involved into the NEAR ecosystem after my talk \\\\\\\"WebAssembly Music\\\\\\\" at the WebAssembly Summit 2020 ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8j_ieOm4vE ), where the idea of music published in tiny WebAssembly files was launched. I made a proof of this by publishing the first music NFT on NEAR https://x.com/salomonsen_p/status/1369699664908410885, which also then lead me to NEARCON 2021 for speaking about the project https://youtu.be/2OgeSuACr2c?si=EjzDIPgkhml9HlHh\\\\n\\\\nAfter this I\\\\\\'ve had various projects on NEAR including the JSinRust project for combining the standard Rust smart contracts with Javascript for customizing. This is also the hackaton project that I\\\\\\'ve submitted https://devpost.com/software/jsinrust-nearopenai\\\\n\\\\nAnother project I\\\\\\'ve spent much time for, with the main purpose of tax reporting of income on NEAR is the Ariz Portfolio: https://arizportfolio.near.page/\\\\n\\\\nI am also a contributor to the DevHUB platform, and very much looking forward to meet my fellow contributors.\\\\n\\\\n# Travel itinerary and costs\\\\nI\\\\\\'m traveling from Sandefjord, Norway, flying directly from Oslo, Norway to Bangkok.\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'ve already booked and paid for flight and hotel, so these are my expenses so far:\\\\n\\\\nEUR 1 076,01 = 1,169 USD ( 2024-10-12 )\\\\nNOK 4366,24 = 406 USD ( 2024-10-12 )\\\\n\\\\n**Total 1,575 USD**\\\\n\\\\n# Project plan\\\\nI am planning to hack on the JSInRust+NEAROpenAI project which you can read more about here: https://devpost.com/software/jsinrust-nearopenai\\\\n\\\\nI am also hoping to be able to present updates on the WebAssembly music project, the Ariz portfolio project and talk about what we\\\\\\'re hacking on with the DevHUB platform.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "petersalomonsen.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1575", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130767603}
